description: Professionals who define product strategy, prioritize features, and drive product development to meet customer needs and business goals

career_levels.title: Associate Product Manager
key_responsibilities: Support senior PMs in feature definition and user research
Write user stories and acceptance criteria
Analyze product metrics and user feedback
Coordinate with engineering and design teams
Create product documentation and presentations
required_skills: Basic understanding of product development lifecycle
nice_to_have: Familiarity with product tools (JIRA, Figma, Analytics platforms)

career_levels.title: Product Manager
key_responsibilities: Own product roadmap for specific feature area
Conduct user research and define product requirements
Prioritize features based on impact and effort
Work with engineering to deliver quarterly releases
Track KPIs and report on product performance
Coordinate go-to-market with marketing and sales
required_skills: Strong product sense and UX intuition
Ability to write clear product requirements
nice_to_have: Technical depth to engage with engineers
career_levels.promotion_criteria: Successfully launches features with measurable impact, demonstrates strategic thinking, strong cross-functional leadership

career_levels.title: Senior Product Manager
key_responsibilities: Own product strategy for major product line
Define long-term vision and roadmap
Lead discovery for complex product problems
Make strategic trade-off decisions
Mentor junior PMs
Influence company product direction
Present to executives and board
required_skills: Track record of successful product launches with business impact
Advanced data analysis and metrics interpretation
Strong product intuition validated by results
Ability to say no and prioritize ruthlessly
Experience with monetization and business models
career_levels.promotion_criteria: Drives significant business outcomes, influences org-wide product strategy, demonstrates thought leadership

career_levels.title: Principal Product Manager / Group PM
key_responsibilities: Define strategy across multiple product lines
Lead cross-functional initiatives company-wide
Manage team of product managers
Represent product org in executive planning
Drive product culture and best practices
Partner with C-suite on company strategy
required_skills: Proven ability to scale products and teams
career_levels.promotion_criteria: Organizational-level impact, develops other PMs successfully, shapes company direction

career_levels.title: Director / VP of Product
key_responsibilities: Set product vision and strategy for entire company
Build and scale product management organization
Partner with CEO on company direction
Own P&L for product lines
Represent product in board meetings
Drive market positioning and competitive strategy
required_skills: Track record of building successful products at scale
Deep understanding of business and financial metrics
career_levels.promotion_criteria: Demonstrates company-defining product leadership, builds world-class PM teams

adjacent_roles.transition_path: From Product Manager with interest in go-to-market, positioning, and marketing strategy
adjacent_roles.key_differences: Focus on external communication, positioning, sales enablement vs internal product development

adjacent_roles.transition_path: From Product Manager with strength in execution, coordination, and process optimization
adjacent_roles.key_differences: Focus on program execution across teams vs product strategy and vision

adjacent_roles.transition_path: From Product Manager with deep passion for research methods and user insights
adjacent_roles.key_differences: Specialized focus on research methodology vs broader product ownership

adjacent_roles.transition_path: From Senior PM with strong analytical and business strategy skills
adjacent_roles.key_differences: Company-wide strategic initiatives vs product-specific ownership
